snippet: The former minister, Akis Tsochatzopoulos, was sentenced to eight years in prison in the second high-profile corruption conviction in a week in Greece.
abstract: Akis Tsochatzopoulos, former Greek defense minister, is convicted and sentenced to eight years in prison for concealing assets from authorities.
lead_paragraph: The former minister, Akis Tsochatzopoulos, was sentenced to eight years in prison in the second high-profile corruption conviction in a week in Greece.

headline.seo: Former Greek Defense Minister Convicted in Corruption Case
headline.main: Former Greek Defense Minister Convicted in Corruption Case
headline.print_headline: Greece: Former Minister Convicted of Hiding Assets
